sentence.idiomatic: He never does his homework.
He is always late these days.
She always forgets to bring her textbook.
Your homework hasn't been checked yet.
When taking a test, you should check your answers carefully after you've finished .
She went to the hospital for a physical examination.
When eating you should chew slowly.
What is that in his mouth that he's chewing on?
He likes chewing gum.
Although enduring terrible pain but he keeps on moving forward.
He suddenly felt a piercing pain in his left leg.
My heart hurts from watching him leave.
I have a cold. I feel terrible.
She feels terrible after hearing this unfortunate news.
She feels terrible because she got a low mark on the test.
Children get cavities easily.
You might have a cavity.
Brushing your teeth in the morning and at night is a good way to prevent tooth decay.
There are a lot of people at the hospital that are there to get a filling.
You don't need a filling.
It takes a long time to fill a tooth.
The machine is running normally.
He is sick. He can't go to work as usual.
These past few days, he hasn't been his usual self.
Doctor, recently I’ve had a toothache. Can you take a look at it?
Sure. Come and sit down, open your mouth, and I will take a look. Is it the molar on the lower left side that is sore?
Yes, yes. As soon as I use the teeth on the left side of my mouth to chew things, I feel a piercing sort of pain. It’s really terrible.
Look, your lower left side molar has some decay. It has already turned into a big cavity.
Oh really? So, what needs to be done, Doctor?
You need a filling. But don’t worry, its very straightforward and will be done in no time.
But, will it be very painful? Will I be able to eat normally?
No problem. In the beginning it might be a little bit painful, but in a few days it will be fine.
